channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Australian National Flag Day
item.description:
Sunday, September 3, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Red White and Blue to support Australian National Flag Day.

The Australian National Flag Association aims to promote wider appreciation of the history and significance of our chief national symbol, the Australian flag. Australian National Flag Day was proclaimed by the Governor-General, to commemorate the anniversary of the day on which the Australian national flag was first flown - September 3,1901.  Refer www.australianflag.org.au. All Australians are encouraged to fly or display the Australian National Flag to celebrate Australian National Flag Day on 3 September each year.

This Light Up is organised by: The Australian National Flag Association of Queensland

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Brisbane Festival
item.description:
Sunday, September 3, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Pink to celebrate Brisbane Festival.

Be Bold. Be Brave. Be Brisbane.We believe that a Festival should be festive and celebrate the personality of its city. Brisbane Festival is unlike anything else you can experience in the world. We redefine what an International Arts Festival looks and feels like, staying ahead of the game and bringing the next generation with us. The river and iconic city landmarks are our stage as we create the art that enlivens, delights and disrupts. The curated multi-arts program presents a bold international program transporting our audience beyond the everyday through captivating performances and installations from across the world. We participate in global conversations. Brisbane is a city with boundless ambition, and the program celebrates this through collaborations, commissions and presentations.

This Light Up is organised by: Major Brisbane Festivals Ltd

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Polycystic Kidney Disease Awareness Day
item.description:
Monday, September 4, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Red and White to support Polycystic Kidney Disease Awareness Day.

Polycystic Kidney Disease Australia exists to find a cure for PKD. We fund research. We connect and support Australians and their families with PKD. And we provide education and information to people impacted by PKD. PKD Awareness Day -pkdaustralia.org… is an important fund-raising opportunity to find a cure for PKD which affects 25,000 Australians and their families.

This Light Up is organised by: Polycystic Kidney disease Australia

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

This Light Up is organised by: Polycystic Kidney disease Australia
item.x-trumba:customfield: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: 2023 Women's Health Week
item.description:
Tuesday, September 5, 2023

Sandgate Town Hall will be lit Purple to support 2023 Women's Health Week.

This important week (4-8 September 2023) is a timely reminder for all women, girls, and gender-diverse people to make good health a priority. The week consists of community-run and workplace events, together with online information, designed to improve women‘s health and to encourage them to make healthier choices.

This Light Up is organised by: Jean Hailes for Women's Health

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

item.title: Gynaecological Cancer Awareness Month
item.description:
Wednesday, September 6, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support Gynaecological Cancer Awareness Month.

September is Gynaecological Cancer Awareness Month and we aim to raise awareness and funds to support Cherish Women's Cancer Foundation's mission to fund life-changing medical research and clinical trials to be developed and implemented quickly to find kinder ways to treat women with gynaecological cancer and to ultimately improve survival rates.

This Light Up is organised by: Cherish Women's Cancer Foundation

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Brazil Independence Day
item.description:
Thursday, September 7, 2023

City Hall will be lit Blue, Yellow and Green to celebrate Brazil Independence Day.

The Independence Day of Brazil, commonly called Sete de Setembro, is a national holiday observed in Brazil on 7 September of every year. The date celebrates Brazil's Declaration of Independence from the United Kingdom of Portugal, Brazil and the Algarves on 7 September 1822.

This Light Up is organised by: Organisation of Brazilian Business in Australia

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: International Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder (FASD) Awareness Day
item.description:
Thursday, September 7, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Red to support International Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder (FASD) Awareness Day.

September 9 is Red Shoes Rock Day! An international day of awareness of Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder (FASD). At 9:09 on the 9th day of the 9th month people across Australia, and around the world, collectively take a minute to pause and reflect on the struggles faced by individuals and families living with FASD.

This Light Up is organised by: Foundation for Alcohol Research and Education (FARE)

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

Be Bold. Be Brave. Be Brisbane.We believe that a Festival should be festive and celebrate the personality of its city. Brisbane Festival is unlike anything else you can experience in the world. We redefine what an International Arts Festival looks and feels like, staying ahead of the game and bringing the next generation with us. The river and iconic city landmarks are our stage as we create the art that enlivens, delights and disrupts. The curated multi-arts program presents a bold international program transporting our audience beyond the everyday through captivating performances and installations from across the world. We participate in global conversations. Brisbane is a city with boundless ambition, and the program celebrates this through collaborations, commissions and presentations.
This Light Up is organised by: Major Brisbane Festivals Ltd

item.title: SES Week
item.description:
Monday, September 11, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Orange to support SES Week.

SES continues to assist the community in times of emergency. Volunteers are filled with dedication and respond to thousands of calls every year. In September we celebrate SES Week. This week provides us with the opportunity to honour the hard work and dedication that the SES provides to the communities of Queensland.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland State Emergency Services

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.description:
Tuesday, September 12, 2023

City Hall will be lit Yellow to support Children's Cancer Awareness Month.

The Children's Cancer Foundation strives to improve the lives of those families going through the hardest challenge of their lives as well as fund childhood cancer research.

This Light Up is organised by: Children's Cancer Foundation

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City

item.title: 2023 World Sepsis Day
item.description:
Wednesday, September 13, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Magenta to support 2023 World Sepsis Day.

Sepsis is the final common pathway to death from most infectious diseases. Despite being a medical emergency, Sepsis is still not getting the attention it deserves. Awareness Saves Lives. Learn about Sepsis at www.worldsepsisday.org

This Light Up is organised by: Australian Sepsis Network

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Brisbane Festival
item.description:
Wednesday, September 13, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Pink to celebrate Brisbane Festival.

Be Bold. Be Brave. Be Brisbane.We believe that a Festival should be festive and celebrate the personality of its city. Brisbane Festival is unlike anything else you can experience in the world. We redefine what an International Arts Festival looks and feels like, staying ahead of the game and bringing the next generation with us. The river and iconic city landmarks are our stage as we create the art that enlivens, delights and disrupts. The curated multi-arts program presents a bold international program transporting our audience beyond the everyday through captivating performances and installations from across the world. We participate in global conversations. Brisbane is a city with boundless ambition, and the program celebrates this through collaborations, commissions and presentations.

This Light Up is organised by: Major Brisbane Festivals Ltd

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve of Myotonic Dystrophy Day
item.description:
Thursday, September 14, 2023

Sandgate Town Hall will be lit Green to support Eve of Myotonic Dystrophy Day.

Myotonic dystrophy (DM) is the most common form of adult muscular dystrophy, a wider group of more than 75 genetically inherited neuromuscular conditions which cause progressive deterioration of muscle strength and function. A key attribute of myotonic dystrophy is myotonia, difficulty relaxing a tightened muscle after use. September 15th is International Myotonic Dystrophy Awareness Day with landmarks around the world lighting up green to spread awareness.

This Light Up is organised by: Muscular Dystrophy QLD

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

item.title: Eve of World Lymphoma Awareness Day
item.description:
Thursday, September 14, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Green to support Eve of World Lymphoma Awareness Day.

World Lymphoma Awareness Day (15 September) is our annual day to put lymphoma in the limelight. We hope that by turning landmarks "lime for lymphoma" it will help raise awareness, start conversations, and educate Australians about lymphoma signs and symptoms. More information: https://www.lymphoma.org.au/get-involved/lymphoma-awareness-month/

This Light Up is organised by: Lymphoma Australia Limited

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: World Lymphoma Awareness Day
item.description:
Friday, September 15, 2023

City Hall will be lit Green to support World Lymphoma Awareness Day.

World Lymphoma Awareness Day (15 September) is our annual day to put lymphoma in the limelight. We hope that by turning landmarks "lime for lymphoma" it will help raise awareness, start conversations, and educate Australians about lymphoma signs and symptoms. More information: https://www.lymphoma.org.au/get-involved/lymphoma-awareness-month/

This Light Up is organised by: Lymphoma Australia Limited

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Mexico National Day
item.description:
Saturday, September 16, 2023

Sandgate Town Hall will be lit Green, White and Red to celebrate Mexico National Day.

Mexican Independence Day has been celebrated every year since that momentous day on September 16, 1810. To promote education among Hispanic students many organizations and companies have established scholarships for Hispanic students, as another way of celebrateing Mexican independence.

This Light Up is organised by: Embassy of Mexico in Australia

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

item.title: 2023 Undercover Arts Festival
item.description:
Wednesday, September 20, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue and Light Blue to support 2023 Undercover Arts Festival.

Undercover Artist Festival showcases excellence in disability arts to a national audience through its relationships with Brisbane Festival and Queensland Theatre. As Australia’s premier performing arts and disability festival, Undercover Artist Festival is four incredible days of theatre, dance, comedy, circus, music, cabaret, poetry and more! The Festival will take place over four days 20-23 September 2023.

This Light Up is organised by: Access Arts

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Eve of Malta Independence Day
item.description:
Wednesday, September 20, 2023

City Hall will be lit Red and White to celebrate Eve of Malta Independence Day.

Malta Independence Day is celebrated on the 21 September. Malta gained Independence from the United Kingdom on this day in 1964.

This Light Up is organised by: Honorary Consul of Malta

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Brisbane Festival
item.description:
Saturday, September 23, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Pink to celebrate Brisbane Festival.

Be Bold. Be Brave. Be Brisbane.We believe that a Festival should be festive and celebrate the personality of its city. Brisbane Festival is unlike anything else you can experience in the world. We redefine what an International Arts Festival looks and feels like, staying ahead of the game and bringing the next generation with us. The river and iconic city landmarks are our stage as we create the art that enlivens, delights and disrupts. The curated multi-arts program presents a bold international program transporting our audience beyond the everyday through captivating performances and installations from across the world. We participate in global conversations. Brisbane is a city with boundless ambition, and the program celebrates this through collaborations, commissions and presentations.

This Light Up is organised by: Major Brisbane Festivals Ltd

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
